[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11334484/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11334484)

Coverage remained the same at 69.852% when pulling **12e275849e7e008d23af36a06f5c33eca5d1d06a on iemejia:BEAM-1764-remove-aggregators-flink** into **ae72456b7125a28f2db4b8dad2990b2bb063ca9b on apache:master**.

Hi Devon,

Unfortunately the removal of Aggregators is a blocker for first stable release of Beam. That metrics support in the streaming Dataflow Runner is not quite ready yet is true, but this will be fixed before the release or soon after. This temporary regression was a choice by the Dataflow owners for the good of the Beam project.
Retest this please
R: @aljoscha
Opened #2825 as a rebase of this on top of apache/master
LGTM!
run flink validatesrunner
run dataflow validatesrunner
I suppose @dhalperi and @jkff are better reviewers
Rebased with the text correction, so merging now.

Run Flink ValidatesRunner

LGTM! once Jenkins is green

Coverage decreased (-0.02%) to 69.837% when pulling **def9e069844633eebb4cbb33f7bb60db3f91745c on dhalperi:remove-old-validation** into **ae72456b7125a28f2db4b8dad2990b2bb063ca9b on apache:master**.

Cause was that `TestSparkPipelineOptions.class` was not registered, so after coercion to it and then back to args there were string args that did not correspond to a registered `PipelineOptions` class.
@kennknowles
Shouldn't TestSparkPipelineOptions be updated within the test runner and not before munging within the IT through the TestPipeline.fromArgs/toArgs?
Perhaps. You could file a JIRA for that.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11336691/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11336691)

Coverage remained the same at 69.852% when pulling **44302d2ccfd8bd1ed54f6da7fc43db5e61798380 on aviemzur:disable-sdf-test-in-flink-streaming-flink-runner** into **ae72456b7125a28f2db4b8dad2990b2bb063ca9b on apache:master**.
Note that the parse issue is _not_ caused by the runner mutating the options. It is caused simply by performing `options.as(TestSparkPipelineOptions.class)` with no mutations.
Replacing this with Internals. I'll revert some changes elsewhere.
Worker `beam6` has been unhappy for a while. Since this affect only Flink and the `ValidatesRunner` passed, I will also run the thorough verify manually I guess.
R: @kennknowles
retest this please

Changes Unknown when pulling **1db5de819b994de8ae55f350fadd43eda81ccd55 on XuMingmin:BEAM-2018** into ** on apache:DSL_SQL**.

LGTM

Is there a plan to move over GcsUtil/GcsPathValidator/... into the org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.storage?

Fun fact - we have multiple coders which had over-accepting equals methods, which this change inverts (overly restrictive equals methods). Over-accepting is more dangerous, as workers should be able to use the equality methods in a meaningful sense.

Users who extend `StructuredCoder` are responsible for ensuring their coder conforms to the `StructuredCoder` contract. Users who extend `Coder` should (and will benefit from) implementing a meaningful `equals` and `hashCode` method, but are not required to do so.

wrote:

> Does this MR allow execution of batch pipeline (with BigQuery sinks) more
